definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: Today, "My ugly mother" big heat, "Auntie Cloud" worrying prospects.
sentences.chinese: 如今，《我的醜娘》大熱，《雲嬸》前景堪憂。

sentences.english: Where did you actually find the much talked-about coat?
sentences.chinese: 事實上你是從哪弄來這些大熱外套的？

sentences.english: The movie claims to be a sequel to the previous hit Painted Skin.
sentences.chinese: 《畫壁》號稱是上一部大熱影片《畫皮》的續集。

definition: to be a big hit/to be hugely popular
lit. burn your hand, feel the heat (idiom)/fig. arrogance of the powerful/a mighty figure no-one dares approach/hot (exciting or in favor)
wind direction/the way the wind blows/fig. trend/direction of events/how things develop (esp. how they affect oneself)/public opinion (concerning one's actions)/publicity (usually derog.)/limelight
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
to be popular/to be in luck/to have good luck/to develop smoothly
to show oneself/to appear/(of a deity) to appear in the flesh
tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
